titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania LJS 320: Geometria

msContents.summary: Mathematical treatise with diagrams, illustrations, and exercises. Topics include planar geometry, trigonometry, logarithms, stereometry, perspective, and horology (measurement of time with sundials).
msContents.textLang: German, with Latin headings and terms

supportDesc.extent: 92 leaves : 154 x 94 (145 x 83) mm. bound to 162 x 110 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, ii + 83 + vii leaves; [iv], 1-159, [160-166]; contemporary pagination in green ink, upper outer corners, slightly trimmed.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in approximately 30 long lines; text block framed with double-fillet borders in black ink.

decoDesc.decoNote: Geometrical and surveying drawings and diagrams throughout, in three or four colored inks and sometimes with wash; rubrics and headings in red ink.

binding.p: Marbled paper over boards with title label Geometria on upper cover.

origin.p: Written in Germany in the 18th century.

history.provenance: Sold by Martayan Lan (New York) to Lawrence J. Schoenberg, Aug. 1999.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.
